dataset.title: Micropropagation and evaluation of the camptothecin content of Camptotheca acuminata-CPT analysis

abstract.para: Micropropagation and comptothecin content of shoot tips and nodal stem explants of Camptotheca aucminata, a plant known to have anti-cancer properties, derived from in vitro seedlings were investigated. Induction of multiple shoots from shoot tip explants was much greater than that from stem explants. The greatest shoot production induced from shoot tip explants was achieved on woody plant medium(WPM) with 0.01 mg L-1 α-naphthileneacetic acid(NAA) + 0.5 mg L-1 benzyladenine(BA), forming an average of 6.4 buds per explant in 6 wk. Elongation of these multiple shoots was successful at a lower BA level (0.1 mg L-1) on WPM. Individual shoots were rooted on WPM supplemented with indole-3-butyric acid(IBA) or NAA. A concentration of 1 mg L-1 IBA gave the highest percentage of rooting (100%) and root number (5.6 roots/shoot). The camptothecin content in leaves of seedlings and their micropropagated plants raised from the mother plants grown at Taipei Batonical Garden, and Lienhuachin Central, Taiwan were significantly greater than those from Jiangsu Province, China. Comptothecin of seedlings among the 3 provenances significantly differed. Since a highly positive correlation was found between the comptothecin content of seedlings and their micropropagated plants, this suggests that it is feasible to mass propogate C. acuminata plants cultured in vitro in order to obtain desired clones with high camptothecin content.

section.title: Shoot culture obtain and Multishoots induction
section.para: seeds were collected at Taipei Botanical Garden in 2001. Seed were germinated in vitro.Shoots excised from 6-month-old plantlest in vitro. All shoot induction media were WPM meidum with0-0.01mg/LNAA, 0-2mg/L BA or 0-0.2mg/L TDZ.

section.title: Shoot elongation, rooting and plant out
section.para: Shoot clumps in vitro were transferred into elongation medium. The elongation medium was WPM meidum wiht 0.01 mg/LBA. After 1-1.5month in culture, 1-1.5cm shoot were cultured on WPM meidum with 0-4mg/L NAA or IBA for rooting. Rooted shoots in vitro were transplanted into pots containing with sterilized medium composed with perlite and vermiculite.

section.title: Analysis of Camptothecin
section.para: For the quantification of camptothecin in shoots. The tissue (1 g) was freeze dried and ground to a fine powder with a mortar and pestle. The powdered tissue was extracted 2 times with 20 ml of methanol by sonication, each extraction for 30 min. After sonication, the combined methanolic extract was transfer into glass tube (16 mm x 100 mm) and evaporated to dryness at 40℃ in vacuum evaporator [concentration workstation? Turb Vap LV?] (Zymark Crop., Hopkinton, MA, USA). For analysis, 1 ml methanol was added to the residue and vortexed for 20 seconds, the mixture was filtered through a 0.2 μm filter (Whatman Inc., Fairfield, NJ), The filtrate solution transferred to clean glass vials for analysis.

Isocratic analytical HPLC was performed on a Waters system with a 2996 system photodiode-array detector. (Milford. MA, USA) using a Chromolith Performance RP-18u monolithic column {5μm, 150x4.6mm}(Supelco Disscovery, Bellefonte, PA, USA). The mobile phase for alkaloid elution was 0.03M ammoniumacetate:acetonitrile(60:40), at a flow rate of 1 ml/min with a sample size of 10μl and UV detection at 254nm. The results were also confirmed at 365nm. The quantification of peak area was based on the calibration using a external standard of CPT (Sigma-Aldrich, St. Louis, MO, USA). CPT concentration in samples was expressed as a percentage of dry weight.
